page.title: 04FOUR MARKS BEAVER CLUB
page.content:
BEAVERS: Beavers is the group before Cubs, for boys aged 5-8. Cubs is the next group in the Scout Association for boys aged 8-11. Each group of Beavers is called a colony and the boys are divided into sub-groups called lodges. They play games, draw, paint, make things and cook.
In Four Marks there is a Beaver colony started on June 13 1985 by Mrs B Allison, Mrs A Southgate and Mrs M Parker. The Four Marks Beavers are the first Beaver colony in the Alresford District. Beavers is held every Thursday from 5 - 6p.m. Their uniform is a grey sweatshirt with Beavers written in red on it, black shorts, blue neck scarf with a red woggle to hold the scarf together.
